name: sfchronicle
text:
Bryson DeChambeau, fast becoming the most bulked-up and talked-about player in golf, also counts as one of the most entertaining. His second-round, evenp-par 70 left him six shots behind midday leader Haotong Li in the PGA Championship at Harding Park.
https://t.co/F1Wcj1xNjW

name: sfchronicle
text: Oakland’s Souley Vegan restaurant is gearing up for a huge expansion. Soon, popular dishes like fried seitan and waffles will be available across the state with new delivery- and takeout-only locations in San Francisco, Oakland and Los Angeles. https://t.co/wHdRyaB86r

name: sfchronicle
text: Due to the pandemic, many rural areas have never seen so many vacationers as they are this summer. https://t.co/AirEFuj8vp

name: sfchronicle
text:
Orchestral musicians are used to performing in groups. But what happens when the COVID-19 pandemic puts a hold on that? 

S.F. Symphony’s solution is a new program that strips music down to its bare bones — one musician, one listener.

https://t.co/BDOlvujIWM

name: sfchronicle
text: JUST IN: The Bay Area's COVID-19 death toll has reached 900 lives lost as the virus continues its rampage. As of Friday evening, the region recorded 60,049 coronavirus cases in total since the start of the pandemic. https://t.co/TGb0ZYciTK

name: sfchronicle
text:
A's fans won’t be stopped in their efforts to boo the Astros during the series. One fan said he chartered a plane to fly over the Coliseum towing a “Houston Asterisks” banner.

https://t.co/cPBcksmBqu

name: sfchronicle
text: Bay Area testing delays are getting worse. Here's how to know where results will get to you the fastest. https://t.co/EMKL3pRW5Y

name: sfchronicle
text:
Small businesses who need coronavirus help now have until Aug. 8 to apply for the federal Paycheck Protection Program. 

Here's what small business owners in the Bay Area need to know: https://t.co/OdiNTjJFTb

name: sfchronicle
text:
Graduate students at Stanford, one of the richest and most prestigious schools in the country, are questioning whether the university is properly addressing coronavirus concerns as move-ins begin. 

https://t.co/HyvFuv1nOb

name: sfchronicle
text:
Mike Person’s past six months have provided six years’ worth of reflection: He went from starting in Super Bowl LIV in February, to the devastation of being released in March, to announcing his retirement with mixed emotions in June.

https://t.co/Gf7R2IPMn5

name: sfchronicle
text: Here’s a recipe for a particularly well-loved cheesecake from La Viña in Spain’s Basque country: https://t.co/RL8QptK40h

name: sfchronicle
text:
Vallejo officials said they will seek a change of venue and a court order silencing the attorneys and “any affiliated parties” connected to the police killing of Sean Monterrosa, whose family filed a wrongful death suit on Thursday.

https://t.co/8OqtGD07Gt

name: sfchronicle
text:
More than 300 Stanford graduate students, concerned about the university's coronavirus policies, have signed an open letter calling for periodic testing throughout the semester and isolation options for students awaiting test results.

https://t.co/bFcT6pu4NT

name: sfchronicle
text: Two weeks for COVID-19 test results? Widespread testing delays at some sites in the Bay Area are hurting local efforts to contain the virus's spread. https://t.co/d2ZVf71e11

name: sfchronicle
text: Inspired by a love of grilled local king salmon and hundreds of hours working grills, columnist Christian Reynoso (@xtianreynoso) asked: What if I grilled (almost) everything for the sandwich — salmon, bread and even the bacon? https://t.co/YNKBStZ51w

name: sfchronicle
text:
A cross between a New York cheesecake and a flan, the proclaimed 'most famous cheesecake in all of Europe' bakes with a "natural crust that transitions gradually into the creamiest of cheese custards."

Here's how to make one of your own: https://t.co/DkJkR9tnIF

name: sfchronicle
text:
The 10-minute film “Going It Alone: A Guide to Being Single in a Pandemic” is an attempt to answer cries for help for those who stumble across it, and to let people know that there are ways to cope. 

The film has been up on YouTube since May 22: https://t.co/btHYjc0Ofs

name: sfchronicle
text:
Nearly halfway through its first major championship, Harding Park is well positioned to extend a long history of producing elite champions. As the 102nd PGA Championship heads to the weekend, several major champions linger in contention.

https://t.co/qqj7qh1pXT

name: sfchronicle
text: In the old days, Tiger Woods had a horseshoe in his glove and on his worst day he had a puncher’s chance. But these are the new days, and Tiger is old, writes @ScottOstler. https://t.co/Q2UtPQWZyQ

name: sfchronicle
text:
The Dodgers teed off on Jeff Samardzija for three home runs Friday night and hit four in all, and the Giants failed to rebound and lost 7-2 in another sloppy effort, dropping three games below .500 for the first time.

@JohnSheaHey has the recap: https://t.co/hhNmbX8dBY

name: sfchronicle
sfchronicle
text:
An increasing number of children are being infected with COVID-19 and more than 200 of them — including 29 in California — are suffering from severe inflammatory reactions that can be life threatening, the CDC reported. 

https://t.co/GDdWLIVpbB

name: sfchronicle
text:
The comet Neowise rises over Clear Lake, nurses perform tests at Laguna Honda Hospital, Indira Allegra creates a memorial in Oakland for those lost to COVID-19 and police brutality.

Frame by frame, experience the best photojournalism of the past month: https://t.co/1GRtRFRfhv

name: sfchronicle
text:
Latest on major CA wildfires:

- Gold Fire (Lassen County): 22,634 acres, 98% contained
- July Complex Fire (Siskiyou County) : 83,261 acres, 97% contained 
- Apple Fire (Riverside County): 30, 517 acres, 97% contained

Latest on our Fire Tracker >>> https://t.co/lNKW0knx4e

name: sfchronicle
text:
Through a peculiar series of events, the wreck of a former opium clipper off the Mendocino coast in 1850 turned out to play a key role in the development of California’s economy.
https://t.co/MJju7EVVhp

name: sfchronicle
text:
Inside Lands, scheduled to run Aug. 28-29 exclusively on Twitch, is a two-day virtual event featuring past Outside Lands performances, premiering new live-stream content and highlighting local small businesses & individuals that shape the annual festival.
https://t.co/SGgmFouCqD

name: sfchronicle
text:
Nothing beats the charm of Oracle Park, but fans love to talk about the Giants and how conditions might improve as the Farhan Zaidi era gains momentum.
https://t.co/8VLHh0z1y8
